Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] SURT question

Hi Tom,

> Igor Ranitovic writes:
>>> I need to do this in the separate SURT file that I specify in the WUI?
>>> I'm not including these with the seeds.
>> If you are using SurtPrefixedScope or DecidingScope with SurtPrefixedDecideRule than yes, you should 
>> add + to surts. Both surt and seed files can been mixture of both seeds and SURTs.
> 
> OK. This is good to know. The documentation, as I remember reading
> when I was creating my SURTs, didn't imply this. Overall a lot of
> knowledge about using SURTs is spread through to many
> documents/messages/wiki entries. The fact that I have to put a '+' in
> front of the surts in an external SURTs file is counter-intuitive to
> me.

I agree. Surts-source-file is counter-intuitive since the file name indicates that the file contains 
surt prefixes rather than a mixed source of different scope forms (e.g +http://archive.org or 
+archive.org). However, I think that we should keep '+' as an indicator that conversion to surt 
prefixes is applied. We should definitely make this clear in the user manual and UI.

Take care,
i.
